isis.stitle: TSI 90-16-06 - Installation, Roof Air Deflector and Roof Air Deflector Extension

subjectgroup.subject: Installation, Roof Air Deflector and Roof Air Deflector Extension

geninfo.para: This TSI replaced 9600/9700 Series information in TSI-89-16-1 dated August, 1989. Please discard TSI-89-16-1.

warning.para: Do not attempt installation while muffler and tail pipe are hot. Contact with hot surfaces can cause serious personal injuries. This installation requires personnel to work on roof of vehicle or on ladders. Extra care must be taken. Falling from heights can cause serious personal injuries.

caution.para: Slings dangling from lifting device can snag air deflector or side deflector extension while vehicle is being driven away after assembly has been completed, and can cause extensive vehicle damage.
Bolts forced into misaligned holes will induce stress in material and can cause extensive material damage. Redrill any set of misaligned holes before inserting bolt.
Do not overtighten fasteners. Overtightening will cause damage to fiberglass panels.

note.para: Two people are needed to complete this installation. Air deflector extensions are assembled to air deflector before placing on vehicle. To avoid distorting deflector and extension panels, install each bolt with washers and nut as each hole is drilled. Install bolts that will be visible so that heads are on finished side of deflector or extensions.

partsinfo.para: Roof protection must be available. It can be made from a remnant of indoor-outdoor carpeting, or Saf-Tred stair tread material or other material that will protect paint from damage and provide non-slip surface. Refer to Figure 1.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Proper Use Of Roof Protective Covering

partsinfo.para: A special air deflector lifting sling can be made from lightweight chain, rubber hose, bolts and nuts, plus small angle stock. Refer to Figure 2 for details.

figure.caption: Figure 2. Special Lifting Sling Detail

partsinfo.para: In order to allow the air deflector to clear air horns on 9600 Series with 100 inch BBC, material has to be cut from the deflector. The template pattern shown in Figure 3 can be used if no template is provided with the air deflector installation kit.

figure.caption: Figure 3. Air Deflector Cut-Out Template Dimensions (9600 W/100 Inch BBC Only)

calloutgroup.callout1: A. SET TEMPLATE AT EDGE OPENING
B. MARK FOR CUTOUT (BOTH SIDES OF AIR DEFLECTOR)
C. SET AT BOTTOM OF AIR SHIELD
D. PAINT CUT EDGES OF OPENING

partsinfo.para: For 9600 installations a special assembly fixture is required to add strength to the panels before they are fastened in place on the roof. Refer to Figure 4 for details.

figure.caption: Figure 4. Assembly Fixture Dimensions (9600 Only)

calloutgroup.callout1: A. 1 INCH X 2 INCH WOOD APPROXIMATELY 50 INCH (127 MM)

item.para: Lifting device to hold 300 pounds (Accolift® hand chain hoist, #1320010, 1/2-ton maximum capacity, or equivalent), located so as to allow vehicle and deflector to pass underneath.
Two Visegrip® pliers, VP11SP, or equivalent.
One three-foot stepladder with padded top edge.
Padded frame stand. Refer to Figure 5.

figure.caption: Figure 5. Frame Stand

calloutgroup.callout1: A. PROTECTIVE COVER (CLOTH AND TAPE, FOR EXAMPLE)

svcproc.title: INSTALLATION: CAB ROOF AIR DEFLECTOR - 9600 ONLY

step1.para: Remove air horns from roof brackets on left and right sides if equipped.
Unpack roof air deflector (Item 2, Figure 6) and paint. Refer to the PAINT and REFINISHING section in the Service Manual for procedure.

figure.caption: Figure 6. 9600 Cab Roof Air Deflector

calloutgroup.callout1: 5. 3/8-16 X 1.0 INCH BOLTS, FLAT WASHERS, LOCKNUT (WITH SIDE MOUNTING BRACKETS)
6. 3/8-16 X 1 1/4 INCH BOLTS, FLAT WASHERS, LOCKNUT (WITH FRONT MOUNTING BRACKETS)
30. SPACER (SECURED TO ROOF AT THE ASSEMBLY PLANT)

step1.para: Secure air deflector on blocks high enough to permit attachment of lifting sling at bottom. Refer to SPECIAL TOOLS.

Attach lifting sling to air deflector ( Figure 7). At front, attach sling studs to the end holes above cut-out. Fasten with nuts but do not tighten. At rear, attach sling hooks to corner holes on deflector rear reinforcement. Then hitch up the excess chain and use a bolt and nut to keep it together.

figure.caption: Figure 7. Attaching Lifting Sling To Air Deflector

calloutgroup.callout1: A. ATTACHING SLING TO AIR DEFLECTOR
C. BOLT - END OF LIFTING SLING
D. HOOK - END OF LIFTING SLING

step1.para: Attach the front mounting bracket (Item 1, Figure 6) to the air deflector with fasteners (Item 6). Do not tighten nuts.

caution.para: The cab or sleeper roof may be damaged if excessive weight is placed on it. To avoid causing damage, minimize body contact with the roof and do not stand on it. Use a ladder resting on the deck plate and against the back panel to gain access. Always protect cab paint from damage and make sure another person holds the ladder secure while in use.

step1.para: Remove the nuts (Items 27, 28, Figure 6) from the bolts (Item 29).

note.para: Use tape to secure the bolts in place. They can drop into the cab roof once the nuts are removed.

step1.para: With help from another person, guide air deflector into position on roof.

Align air deflector outside of roof mounting bracket (Item 3, Figure 6) with front mounting bracket positioned to slide onto roof bolts. The side brackets should be assembled on top of reinforcement with dogleg up. Remove any tape from bolts and re-attach nuts (Items 27, 28, Figure 6). DO NOT TIGHTEN.
Remove sling parts and secure away from work area.
Using side brackets (Item 3, Figure 6) as templates and a 13/32 inch diameter bit, backdrill 4 holes in air deflector at centers of slots in the brackets.
Attach air deflector side brackets with fasteners (Item 5). Refer to Figure 1 for the proper bolt/washer/nut detail. Do not tighten nuts.
Align air deflector with cab roof and tighten all nuts until snug. Tighten locknuts (Items 27, 28, Figure 6) to 25 ft. lbs. (34 Nm).

caution.para: Do not overtighten fasteners. Overtightening will damage fiberglass panels.

step1.para: If equipped, put air horns through openings in deflector and re-install.

svcproc.title: CAB ROOF AIR DEFLECTOR AND AIR DEFLECTOR EXTENSION

step1.para: Unpack air deflector (Item 1, Figure 8), side and center extensions (Items 2 and 3) and paint. Refer to the PAINT and REFINISHING section of the Service Manual for procedures.

figure.caption: Figure 8. Cab Roof Air Deflector And Extension Assembly

step1.para: Secure air deflector on blocks 8 to 10 inches high to permit working underneath it ( Figure 9).

figure.caption: Figure 9. Positioning Air Deflector On Blocks

step1.para: Using Visegrip® pliers or similar tool, assemble by overlapping air deflector on side extensions and clamp together temporarily ( Figure 10). Panels may require trimming to fit correctly. Align uniformly with gap of 1/4 inch or less.

figure.caption: Figure 10. Connecting Panels Together With Clamps

step1.para: Use assembly fixture ( Figure 11) to align left and right side extensions by inserting pins on fixture into rearmost holes on top. It may be necessary to loosen, adjust and retighten clamping tools for best alignment and to prevent distortion of panels.
Using side extensions as templates and 11/32 inch diameter bit, backdrill 14 holes in air deflector.

figure.caption: Figure 11. Assembly Fixture Detail

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. 1 INCH X 2 INCH WOOD APPROXIMATELY 50 INCHES (127 MM)

step1.para: Attach the side extensions to the air deflector using fasteners (Item 19, and Figure 12). Place bolts with attached washers in 6 holes on each side extension counting from the bottom. Leave the top holes open. Tighten until snug and remove clamping tools.

figure.caption: Figure 12. Fastening Panels Together

step1.para: Prepare frame stand ( Figure 5) by padding top to prevent damage to center extension. Adjust height of frame stand. Frame stand must be tall enough to support center extension in final assembly position.
Center frame stand between side extensions near air deflector ( Figure 13).

figure.caption: Figure 13. Location Of Frame Stand To Support Center Extension Assembly

calloutgroup.callout1: B. FINAL POSITION OF FRAME STAND TO SECURE CENTER EXTENSION IN PLACE

step1.para: With help from another person place center extension on frame stand underneath air deflector and side extensions and align. Panels may require trimming to fit correctly with a uniform gap of 1/4 inch or less between them.
Using air deflector and side extensions as templates and an 11/32 inch diameter bit, drill 2 holes in corners of center extension (holes may be pre-drilled on 9700 extensions).
Secure center extension to air deflector and side extensions with 2 fasteners in these corner holes. Do not tighten nuts.

Using clamping tools, temporarily clamp center extension to side extensions at rear. Align side extensions, center extension and air deflector so a maximum 1/4 inch gap is maintained. Tighten nuts until snug. Remove frame stand.

caution.para: Do not overtighten nuts. Overtightening will cause damage to fiberglass panels.

step1.para: Using side extensions as templates and 11/32 inch diameter bit, drill 8 more holes in center extension (14 holes for 9700 installation).
Using center extension as template and 11/32 inch diameter bit, backdrill 5 holes in air deflector (7 holes for 9700 installation).

Attach center extension to air deflector and side extensions with 4 fasteners (Item 19, Figure 14) on each side extension, counting from the rear (7 fasteners for 9700). Use 5 fasteners for the air deflector (7 fasteners for 9700). Tighten until snug.

figure.caption: Figure 14. Fastener Detail - Center Extension To Side Extension And Air Deflector

calloutgroup.callout1: A. CENTER EXTENSION TO SIDE EXTENSION
B. CENTER EXTENSION TO AIR DEFLECTOR
19. 5/16-18 X 1 1/4 INCH BOLT, FLAT WASHERS, LOCKNUT

caution.para: Do not overtighten nuts. Overtightening will cause damage to fiberglass panels.

step1.para: Remove clamping tools.
Slide extension molding (Item 4, Figure 15) into molding brackets (Item 5) at rear of side extensions (Item 2). Lubricate if necessary using foamy glass cleaner or similar product ( Figure 16).

figure.caption: Figure 15. Extension Molding Attachment

calloutgroup.callout1: A. 3 INCH TYPICAL, 2 PLACES (TOP AND BOTTOM)

figure.caption: Figure 16. Applying Lubricant To Molding

step1.para: Locate and mark points on molding brackets (Item 5, Figure 15) 3 inches from top and 3 inches from bottom. Fasten molding to brackets using self drilling screws.

note.para: Use protective covering or material when working on roof to prevent paint damage. Refer to SPECIAL TOOLS.

step1.para: Attach lifting sling to air deflector assembly. Refer to Figure 17 for correct attachment and SPECIAL TOOLS for description of the lifting sling.

figure.caption: Figure 17. Lifting Sling Attachment

note.para: For 9600 With 110 inch BBC only, also perform Step 20.

step1.para: Cut slots in air deflector to clear the reinforcements on the roof.

step2.para: Raise air deflector assembly to chest height.
Locate templates supplied in kit for cutting clearance slots. Refer to SPECIAL TOOLS for a template pattern.

At left and right, align templates on front of air deflector at bottom to mark locations of reinforcements and secure in position ( Figure 18). Using templates as guides, cut slots in air deflector with suitable saw, then file and paint rough edges.

figure.caption: Figure 18. Using Template To Cut Slots In Air Deflector - 9600 With 110 Inch BBC

step1.para: Using clamping tools, attach cover plate to air deflector ( Figure 19).

step2.para: Using cover plate as a template and 3/8 inch diameter bit, drill 2 holes in air deflector.
Fasten cover plate with 2 fasteners. Tighten until snug.

caution.para: Do not overtighten nuts. Overtightening will cause damage to fiberglass panels.

figure.caption: Figure 19. Attaching Cover Plate To Air Deflector - 9700 Series Only

note.para: For all, except 9600 with 110 inch BBC, perform Step 22.

step1.para: Attach the front mounting bracket (Item 7, Figure 21) to the air deflector with fasteners (Item 21). Do not tighten.

caution.para: The cab or sleeper roof may be damaged if excessive weight is placed on it. To avoid causing damage, minimize body contact with the roof and do not stand on it. Use a ladder resting on the deck plate and against the back panel to gain access. Always protect cab paint from damage and make sure another person holds the ladder secure while in use.

step1.para: With help from another person, guide assembly into position on roof ( Figure 20).

figure.caption: Figure 20. Positioning Air Deflector On Cab Roof (9700 Shown)
Figure 21. Air Deflector Attachment (Not 9600 With 110 Inch BBC)

calloutgroup.callout1: 21. 5/16-18 X 1 1/2 INCH BOLT, FLAT WASHERS, SPECIAL FLAT WASHER, LOCKNUT
22. 3/8-16 X 1.0 INCH BOLT, FLAT WASHERS, SPECIAL FLAT WASHER, LOCKNUT
30. SPACER (SECURED TO ROOF AT THE ASSEMBLY PLANT)

note.para: Choose only one of the following steps depending on the model being assembled.

para.emph: For all but 9600 with 110 inch BBC:

item.para: Remove nuts (Item 27 and 28, Figure 21) from carriage bolts (Item 29).

para.emph: NOTE: Use tape to secure the bolts in place. They can drop into the cab roof once nuts are removed.

item.para: Standing on ladder, align assembly so the mounting bracket (Item 7, Figure 21) slides onto the roof bolts and the assembly is positioned outside of mounting brackets (Item 8, Figure 21). The side angle brackets must be installed on top of reinforcement with dogleg pointing up.
Remove any tape from bolts and re-attach nuts (Item 27 and 28) DO NOT TIGHTEN.

svcproc.para: •For 9600 with 110 inch BBC only: Standing on ladder align assembly outside of front mounting brackets (Item 12, Figure 22) and mounting brackets (Items 10 and 11) on left and right sides. Angle bracket (Item 11) should be assembled on bottom of reinforcement with dogleg down. Angle bracket (Item 10) should be assembled on top of reinforcement with dogleg pointing down.

figure.caption: Figure 22. Air Deflector Attachment (9600 With 110 Inch BBC)

calloutgroup.callout1: 23. 5/16-18 X 1 1/2 INCH BOLT, FLAT WASHERS, LOCKNUT

step1.para: Attach air deflector to mounting brackets. Refer to Figure 21 and Figure 22 for proper fastener locations. Do not tighten nuts.
Remove lifting sling parts and secure away from work area.

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 23 for all item numbers appearing in parentheses until otherwise stated.

step1.para: Inspect cab side extender bracket (Item 13, Figure 23) for accumulations of foreign material. Remove from holes and surfaces any foreign material that will interfere with installation.
Attach side extension support (Item 14) to bracket with fasteners (Item 26) using tapped holes on bracket. Tighten to 30 ft-lbs. (46 Nm).

Align each side extension (Item 2) and its support (Item 14). Long axis of support and rear edge of extension must be parallel. Using supports as templates and 13/32 inch diameter bit, backdrill 3 holes in each side extension.
Attach side extensions to their supports with fasteners (Item 24). Do not tighten nuts.

caution.para: The cab or sleeper roof may be damaged if excessive weight is placed on it. To avoid causing damage, minimize body contact with the roof and do not stand on it. Use a ladder resting on the deck plate and against the back panel to gain access. Always protect cab paint from damage and make sure another person holds the ladder secure while in use.

step1.para: With help from another person, align air deflector and extension assembly. Tighten all fasteners in side extension supports until snug and at front of air deflector to 25 ft-lbs. (34 Nm). Tighten fasteners attaching sides of air deflector to rear mounting brackets from Step 24 until snug.

caution.para: Do not overtighten nuts. Overtightening will cause damage to fiberglass panels.

step1.para: Attach long extension brace (Item 15) and short brace (Item 26) between center extension at its left corner with fastener (Item 19). Repeat on right side of center extension, but the short brace (Item 16) is attached first, then the long brace (Item 15). Refer to Figure 23 for fastener details (View A-A and B-B). Do not tighten nuts.

Attach short extension brace (Item 16) and opposite long extension brace (Item 15) to mounting bracket (Item 17) with a faster (Item 19). The bolt head must be on the inside with braces on other side of the bracket. Do not tighten nut.
Attach braces (Items 15 and 16) to opposite mounting bracket (Item 17) in a similar manner.
Align air deflector assembly and tighten nuts until snug.

caution.para: Do not overtighten nuts. Overtightening will cause damage to fiberglass panels.

step1.para: Attach extension side braces (Item 18) to each mounting bracket (Item 17) with fasteners (Item 19).
Position brace (Item 18) against side extension, parallel of roof, and using the brace as a template and an 11/32 inch bit, backdrill holes through each side extension.
Attach the brace to the side extension (Item 2) with a fastener then tighten until snug.

caution.para: Do not overtighten nuts. Overtightening will cause damage to fiberglass panels.

step1.para: Clear lifting slings, remove roof protective cover, and move ladders away from vehicle before driving away.

figure.caption: Figure 23. Installation Of Cab Side Extender Braces (9600 Only)

calloutgroup.callout1: 19. 5/16-18 X 1 1/4 INCH BOLT, FLAT WASHERS, LOCKNUT
24. 5/16-18 X 1 1/4 INCH BOLT, FLAT WASHER, SPECIAL WASHER, LOCKNUT
26. 5/16-18 X 1 1/4 INCH SCREW, FLAT WASHER, LOCK WASHERS

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 24 for all item numbers in parentheses unless otherwise stated.

step1.para: Inspect side extension bracket (Item 3, Figure 24) for accumulations of foreign material. Remove from holes and surfaces any foreign material that will interfere with installation.
Attach side extension supports (Item 14) to bracket (Item 13). Tighten to 30 ft-lbs. (46 Nm) torque.

Align each side extension (Item 2) and its support (Item 14). The long axis of support and rear edge of extension must be parallel. Using supports as templates and 13/32 inch diameter bit, backdrill 3 holes in each side extension.
Attach supports to their side extensions. Do not tighten nuts.

With help from another person, align air deflector and extension assembly. Tighten all fasteners in side extension supports and at front of air deflector. Also, tighten fasteners attaching sides of air deflector to mounting brackets until snug.

caution.para: Do not overtighten nuts. Overtightening will cause damage to fiberglass panels.

step1.para: Clear lifting sling, remove roof protective cover and move ladders away from vehicle before driving away.

figure.caption: Figure 24. Side Extension Attachment (9700 Series)

calloutgroup.callout1: 13. SIDE EXTENSION BRACKET 89 INCH BBC, 110 INCH BBC
